thread.title: The optical illusion in this picture of strawberries is freaking people out (10 photos)
thread.title_full: The optical illusion in this picture of strawberries is freaking people out (10 photos)

author: Alex
title: The optical illusion in this picture of strawberries is freaking people out (10 photos)
text:
View as Slideshow 1 
Akiyoshi Kitaoka , a psychology professor at Ritsumeikan University in Kyoto, Japan, has made a name for himself creating mind-fucking optical illusions . His latest piece to go viral is an unnerving image of a strawberry cake. 2 
The reason the strawberries appear red — despite not a single red pixel appearing in the photo — is because of a phenomenon called color constancy. Basically, our foolish brains are so conditioned to associate strawberries with the color red that we refuse to see them in the grey color they’ve been shaded in here. 
Not buying it? Twitter user Carson Mel l proved that Kitaoka wasn’t lying: 3 
It’s the same effect that freaked people out during the Great Dress Debate of 2015 , and why many people saw the dress as black and blue rather than white and gold. 
Here’s the original image of the strawberry cake: 4 
And for more eyeball-warping fun, here are some bonus illusions from Kitaoka: 5
